The Bzip2 package does not contain a configure script. There are two Makefile, one for the shared library, and the other for the static library. Since we need both, We do the compilation in two stages. First the shared library:

variablelist.title: The meaning of the make parameter:

listitem.para: This will cause Bzip2 to be built using a different Makefile file, in this case the Makefile-libbz2_so file, which creates a dynamic libbz2.so library and links the Bzip2 utilities against it.

sect2.para: Compile and test the package with:
Install the shared bzip2 binary into the /bin directory, make some necessary symbolic links, and clean up:

screen.userinput: cp -v bzip2-shared $LFS/bin/bzip2 cp -av libbz2.so* $LFS/lib ln -sv ../../lib/libbz2.so.1.0 $LFS/usr/lib/libbz2.so rm -v $LFS/usr/bin/{bunzip2,bzcat,bzip2} ln -sv bzip2 $LFS/bin/bunzip2 ln -sv bzip2 $LFS/bin/bzcat
